sentences: Mõrva eest võidakse anda karm karistus.
context: The word 'mõrva' is the genitive singular form of the Estonian noun 'mõrv', which means murder. In Estonian grammar, the genitive case is used to indicate possession or origin, so 'mõrva' can mean 'of murder,' 'belonging to murder,' or be used in constructions where something relates to murder. It's commonly found in phrases like 'mõrva juhtum' (murder case) or 'mõrva eest' (for murder).
